checkpoint.name: UPHC has system for periodic maintenance of Building
There is no clogged/over flowing drain in facility
Fixtures and Patient Furniture are intact and maintained in OPD
Trolley & cupboard etc are painted & in intact condition
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Cupboard/ trolley are not rusted, chipped or broken

checkpoint.name: Fixtures and Patient Furniture are intact and maintained in OPD
There is system of timely corrective break down maintenance of the equipments
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask for the procedure of repair, Check if some equipment is lying idle since long time due to maintenance

checkpoint.name: UPHC ensures that all equipments are covered under AMC including preventive maintenance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: ILR, deep freezer , Lab equipments etc.

checkpoint.name: Cold Storage equipments are under AMC and temperature log book
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for AMC for ILR, deep freezer

checkpoint.name: Records of equipments maintenance are available with facility
Adequate illumination at work station
Illumination in IUD section area adequate for condition procedures
Adequate illumination at Collection area
Adequate illumination in patient care and procedure areas
Adequate illumination in circulation area
Funds/Grants provided are utilized in specific time limit
Salaries and compensation are provided to contractual staff on time
There is no backlog in payment to beneficiaries as per their entitlement under different schemes
There is system to track and ensure that funds are received on time
Facility provides utilization certificate for funds on time
Regular monitoring and evaluation of staff is done against defined criteria
Facility has defined criteria for assessment of quality of outsourced services
Actions are taken against non compliance / deviation from contractual obligations
Check for that Contract document has provision for deduction of payment if quality of services is not good
Payment to the outsourced services are made on time
Check Medical Certificate are issued as per defined criteria
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check cycle time to issue medical certificate, check records & also denial policy

checkpoint.name: A copy of issued Medical Certificate is kept for records
Identification marks and Patients address is mentioned in medical certificate
Defined formats for issuing Medical Certificate is available
Medical Certificate are issued on the day of request
Register is maintained for keeping details of Medical Certificate issued
Dress and I cards have been provided to ASHAs
All clinical and support staff adhere to their respective dress code
I Cards and Name plates have been provided to all the staff
Availability of Licensee under Clinical Establishment Act
Availability of authorization for handling Bio Medical waste from pollution control board
Availability of NOC for Fire Safety
Field visit plan of Medical Officer is prepared
There is system of monitoring and review of adherence to Field Visit Plan
Field visit plan of ANM is prepared
Field visit plan of LHV is prepared
Duty roster of all staff is prepared, updated and communicated
Compliance to MTP Act for abortion Procedures
No Smoking sign is displayed at the prominent places in UPHC
Any positive report of notifiable disease is intimated to designated authorities
Staff is aware of requirements of medico legal cases
Job Description support and administrative staff is defined
Administrative and Support staff is aware of his/her role and responsibility
LHV are aware of her role and responsibility
Job Description ANMs is defined
Staff Nurses are aware of his/her role and responsibility
Job Description Staff Nurse is defined
Job Description ASHA is defined
ANMs are aware of his/her role and responsibility
Medical officer is aware of his/her role and responsibility
Job description of Medical officer is defined
ASHA is aware of her role and responsibility
Job Description LHV is defined
Laboratory Technician is aware of his/her role and responsibility
Job Description Laboratory Technician is defined
Expiry dates' are maintained at emergency drug tray
No expired reagent found
No expiry drug found at dressing/ Injection Room
There is system about transfer of surplus / near expiry drugs to other nearby facility / district stores
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for initiation of transfer process done with adequate remaining shelf life (preferably at least 3 months in advance)

checkpoint.name: Facility has a procedure in place to avoid expiry of medicines and identifies near expiry drugs
There is a earmarked area for keeping expiry drugs distant from regular drugs to avoid mixing
Records for expiry and near expiry reagent are maintained
There is a established process for disposal fo expiry drugs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Staff is aware of the process and Check for last condemnation procedure undertaken

checkpoint.name: Drugs are kept at dry and cool place away from sun light
Check thermometer in ILR is in hanging position
Work instruction for storage of vaccines are displayed at point of use
There is system in place to maintain temperature chart of ILR
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Temp. of ILR: Min +2 degree C to 8 degree C in case of power failure min temp. +10 degree C . Daily temperature log are maintained. Corrective action of any temperature excursion taken.

checkpoint.name: ILR and deep freezer have functional temperature monitoring devices
Staff is aware of Hold over time of cold storage equipments
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Hold over time depends on Factors - the amount of vaccine being stored in the refrigerator, the external temperatures and the refrigerator will affect the duration of time vaccines within the refrigerator will be kept within +2 °C to +8 °C.Do not allow the vaccine to remain in a non-functioning unit for an extended period of time.

checkpoint.name: ILR and deep freezer has functional alarm system
Conditioning of ice packs is done prior to transport
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if staff is aware of how to condition ice pack (water beads on the surface of ice pack and sound of water is heard on shaking it)

checkpoint.name: Check vaccines & diluents are placed in specified shelf/compartment inside the storage unit and are clearly labeled.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: (Top to bottom) : Hep B, DPT, DT, TT, BCG, Measles, OPV. Vaccines are not stored in door. Check food/drinking water not stored in the vaccine refrigerator

checkpoint.name: There is system in place to maintain temperature chart of deep freezers
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Temp. of Deep freezer cabinet is maintained between -15 degree C to -25 degree C.Daily temperature log are maintained. Corrective action of any temperature excursion taken.

checkpoint.name: No stock out of Contraceptives and other consumables
Expenditure and left over records of vaccines is maintained at immunization clinic
Physical verification of inventory is done periodically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Has periodicity of physical verification defined (quaterly/biannually/annually). Check when last physical verification done

checkpoint.name: Drugs are categorized in Vital, Essential and Desirable
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for list of VED categorization

checkpoint.name: Stores has defined minimum and reorder level defined
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for minimum and reorder level defined for vital drug as per their consumption pattern

checkpoint.name: Facility uses bin card system and updated each time stock is handled
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Bin cards are kept for each item in the stock room and physical count of remainind stock done. Check for last posting on the bin card.

checkpoint.name: First expiry first out system is established for drugs
Expenditure & stock register of consumbles are available at laboratory
There is a system of periodic replenishment of drugs and consumable sin ASHA Kits
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Condoms, NISCHAY Kit, Sanitary pads & drugs etc

checkpoint.name: Repeat drugs are given only after approval from medical officer
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Medicines are dispensed to only authorized patients registered for the day

checkpoint.name: List of look alike and sound alike drugs is displayed at dispensing counter
Drugs are dispensed in Envelops
Drug boxes/containers are legibly labeled
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Label is firmly attached to container with Generic name and strength of drug is written

checkpoint.name: Drugs are given for no. of days as prescribed
Drugs are arranged in demarcated boxes /containers /trays
Drugs are not directly dispensed from drug storage area
Dispensing register is updated in real time
Pharmacist check drugs name, strength, dosage form and route of adminstration before dispensing
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if pharmacists dispenses to identified patients

checkpoint.name: Strip cutting is not done
Check Patients having knowledge about correct use of medicines.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Pharmacist providing information about correct use of medicines to the patients- at least purpose, no. of tablets, frequency and duration of treatment.

checkpoint.name: Reagents are labelled appropriately
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Reagents label contain name, concentration, date of preparation/opening, date of expiry, storage conditions and warning

checkpoint.name: Fragile items are not stored at the edges of the shelves.
Sound alike and look alike medicines (LASA) are stored separately in patient care area and pharmacy
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Facility has a list of LASA and are stored separately in patient care area and pharmacy

checkpoint.name:
Drugs and consumables are stored away from water and sources of heat,
direct sunlight etc.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Drugs are not stored in the corridor or outside toilets/damp places

checkpoint.name: Drugs are not stored directly on the floor and adjacent to wall especially walls directly facing sun light
Contraceptives are stored at stored away from moisture, sources of heat and direct sunlight at secured place
All the shelves/racks containing medicines are labelled in pharmacy and drug store
Product of similar name and different strength are stored separately
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Facility has a list of drugs with similar names and different strength and are stored separately & labelled

checkpoint.name: Heavy items are stored at lower shelves/racks
Drugs/ Injectables are stored in container/tray & are labelled
There is specified place to store medicines in Pharmacy
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Drugs are stored according to therapeutic category/alphabetically or according to their dosage form

checkpoint.name: UPHC has process to consolidate and calculate the consumption of all drugs and consumables
Facility has a established procedures for local purchase of drugs in emergency
There is established system of timely indenting of consumables and reagents
Monthly consumption of Contraceptives is calculated and indented accordingly
Forecasting of drugs and consumables is done scientifically based on consumption
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for stock-outs and wastage (expiry, damaged medicines), if any are adjusted while forecasting

checkpoint.name: UPHC has system for timely placing requisition to district drug store
Accounts have been opened for MAS
Data base regarding functional MAS is available at UPHC
Mahila Arogya Samiti has been formed in all the slums served by UPHC
MAS meets every month
RKS meeting are held at prescribed interval
RKS is registered under societies registration act
RKS generates its own resources from donation/leasing of space
Participation of community representatives/NGO/Local bodies is ensured
Minutes of meeting are recorded
UPHC supports in skill development of ASHAs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for timely trainings have been provided to ASHAs, MO orient ASHA at monthly review meeting

checkpoint.name: UPHC monitors the activities assigned to ASHAs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the records that ASHAs attends Monthly Review meetings

checkpoint.name: Incentives and TA/DA to ASHAs are paid on time
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for there Is no backlog

checkpoint.name: There is system of taking feedback from ASHAs to improve the services
Community based monitoring/social audits are done at periodic intervals
Check form P is filled for information required
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Form for presumptive surveillance reporting
Form P contain information Name of reporting unit, state, district, Block,Name of officer incharge along with signature, IDSP reporting week, No.of cases under each disease and syndrome

checkpoint.name: Check form L is filled for information required
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Form for Laboratory surveillance reporting
Form L contain information for Name of Lab, state, district, block, Name & signature of officer incharge along with information about no, of samples tested and no. of sample found positive. Format also include line listing of positive cases except malaria cases along with age &sex breakage

checkpoint.name: Reporting on Form S under IDSP
Reporting format (Form P) are sent to DSU as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Form P will be filled in duplicate (two copies), Surveillance officer may place carbon paper in between 2 sheets, One copy (blue ) is retained by MO and other (Yellow) will be sent to DSU

checkpoint.name: Reporting format (Form L) are sent to District Surveillance Unit (DSU) as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Form L will be filled in duplicate (Blue & Yellow), PHC retain blue copy while Yellow will be sent to DSU

checkpoint.name: Check form W is filled for information required as per format
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Form for Water Quality monitoring
Form W contain information on source of water sample,no. of sample tested from that source and their results

checkpoint.name: Reporting format (Form W) are sent to District surveillance unit (DSU) as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Form W is filled in duplicate (in colour Yellow & Blue) and blue is retained by facility while yellow is sent to DSU

checkpoint.name: Facility monitor & submit the report under National Programme for prevention and control of deafness
Facility reports data regarding Antenatal, Delivery and Postnatal care for availed services
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for all antenatal & delivery cases registered at UPHC are entered in MCTS

checkpoint.name: Reporting for MCTS
Facility utilizes MCTS data for tracing of missed out immunization and ANC cases
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for MCTS is used for missed out immunization/ANC cases

checkpoint.name: Facility reports data about child immunization in MCTS
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check all child immunization cases are entered in MCTS

checkpoint.name: Facility utilizes MCTS data for action planning
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff how they utilize data for action planning

checkpoint.name: Staff Know AEFI cases to be reported immediately to MO/ District Immunization Officer
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Death , Anaphylaxis, Toxic Shock Syndrome, Hospitalization , Disablity etc.

checkpoint.name: Staff is awrae of Cycle time for reporting FIR/PIR
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
24 hrs for FIR
7 Days for PIR

checkpoint.name: Reporting under Universal immunization program by ANM
Formats for First Information Report & Preliminery Investigation Report are available at the faclity
Routine Monthly reporting is done to District Immunization Officer
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the records

checkpoint.name: Reporting is done on Form 01 (MF 2)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: For reporting of blood smear. Reporting format contain information about patient’s name, age, sex and slum, etc. A code number is given to each patient in terms of blood smear number for identification of each fever case screened, for tracing out to provide radical treatment and also for follow up

checkpoint.name: Reporting is done on Form 02 (MF 4)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Monthly reporting of malaria program of PHC , it provides details of the worker wise blood smears received and their results.

checkpoint.name: Reporting is done on Form 08 (MF 16)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: For reporting drug distribution centre, fever treatment depots & malaria clinics

checkpoint.name: Reporting is done on Form 03 (MF 5)
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Monthly epidemiological report of malaria program of PHC, it provides species wise details of the positive cases and radical treatment provided

checkpoint.name: Facility monitor & submit the report under Iodine deficiency Program
Monthly HIV-TB report
Details of referral from various facilities
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: HIV-TB collaborative activities including line listing of cases referred from ICTC to RNTCP

checkpoint.name: Facility monitor & submit the report under NBCP
Availability of Quarterly reports on New and retreatment cases of TB
Monthly report on programme management, logistics and microscopy filled at all healthcare facilities & sent to CMO/DTO/ concerned TU within defined period
Availability of Monthly report on Program Management, Logistics and Microscopy by Peripheral Health Institutions
Availability of Quarterly report on sputum conversion of New and retreatment cases registered 4-6 month earlier
Availability of Quarterly report on result of treatment of TB patient registered 13-15 month earlier
Reporting is done on form 2 for NPHCE
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Forms contains information on availability of equipments, supporting devices, no. of staff trained, services provided, no. of cases referred etc

checkpoint.name: Reporting is done on MLF -04 under NLEP
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Monthly progress report from PHC to District regarding different DPMR activities

checkpoint.name: All data elements of HMIS are reported
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check HMIS report for filling up of all data elements

checkpoint.name: HMIS data is reported on monthly basis
Reporting for HMIS
Facility monitor & submit the report under NPCDCS
Facility monitor & submit the report under MHP
Unique identification number is given to each patient during process of registration
Patient demographic details are recorded in OPD registration records
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for that patient demographics like Name, age, Sex, Address etc.

checkpoint.name: Clinical staff is not engaged in administrative work during OPD hrs
Every patient is offered a seat and is examined as per clinical condition
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: No patient is consulted in standing position

checkpoint.name: There is procedure for systematic calling of patients one by one
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Patient is called by Doctor/attendant as per his/her turn on the basis of “first come first examine” basis.

checkpoint.name: Referral in of the patient as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Referral of the cases having reaction, disability, neuritis and ulcer.

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of leprosy reaction and their treatment
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: 2 types of reaction: Type 1- Reversal reaction, Type 2- Erthyma Nodosum leprosum(ENL)

checkpoint.name: History taking as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Includes duration of lesion, duration of disability if any, family history/ contact history &previous treatment

checkpoint.name: Standard children (10-14yrs) treatment regimen for MB leprosy is followed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: MB: Rifampicin:450mg once in month,Clofazimine: 150mg once in month,50 mg daily, Dapsone: 50 mg daily (12month). PB: Rifampicin: 450 mg once in month, Dapsone; 50 mg daily (for 6 month)

checkpoint.name: Examination of skin as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Include information No. of patches, colour of patch, morphology of patch, nodule, infiltration, test for loss of sensation in patch

checkpoint.name: Standard adult treatment regimen for MB leprosy is followed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Rifampicin: 600mg once in month, Clofazimine: 300mg once in month & 50mg every day, Dapsone: 100 mg (for 12 month)

checkpoint.name: Management of disability grade I as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: If the duration of disability grade 1 i.e. anaesthesia along the course of trunk nerve is recent (< 6 months), a course of Prednisolone is to be started to treat neuritis.

checkpoint.name: Referral out of Patient as per guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Referral of cases where lepra reaction is difficult to manage,complicated ulcer, eye problem,reconstruction surgery cases, persons needing gradeII foot wear,follow up of RCS

checkpoint.name: Standard adult treatment regimen for PB leprosy is followed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Rifampicin: 600 mg once in month, Dapsone; 100 mg daily (for 6 month)

checkpoint.name: Physical Examination as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Dryness of hands & feet, swelling & redness of patches and joints, Wasting of muscle, visible deformity in hand, feet, eye,Redness on palm or sole, callous, Blister, ulcer,High stepping gait or any change in gait,Appearance of new lesions or expansion of existing lesion,Absence of blink in the eyes,Redness and watering in the eyes

checkpoint.name: Examination of eye as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Look for any redness of the eye,Note “watering from the eye” from history and observation,Observe for blink – Present or Absent, Look for lid gap or inability to close one or both eyes (Lagophthalmos)
and check for normal strength of eye closure,Check the visual acuity of each eye separately, using a Snellen’s chart.

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of adverse reactions to MDT and their management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Like Red urine, anaemia, brown discoloration of skin, gastro intestinal upset. Management reassurance, given iron and folic acid, counselling & give drug with food

checkpoint.name: Staff skilled to fill form S
Diagnosis of hypertension is done as per protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Stage 1 hypertension: Systolic 140/159, diastolic 90/99. Stage 2 hypertension: Sysolic: 160 or higher Diastolic 100 or higher. Based on at least 2 or more properly measured BP reading in sitting position.

checkpoint.name: Risk assessment & diagnosis of diabetics is done as per guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Staff is aware of high risk condition of diabetic & certeria for diagnosis of type II diabetics mellitus

checkpoint.name: Medical Management of diabetes is done as per guideline
Screen women of the age group 30-69 years for early detection of cervix cancer and breast cancer.
Counselling is provided for life style modification as per guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for awarness regarding modification in diet, physical activity, weight control, tabacco cessation & aviodness alcohol intake

checkpoint.name: Medical Management of hypertension is done as per guideline
Risk assessment for cardio vascular disease is done as per guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for awarness of behavioural & psychological risk factor & how medical officer calculate 10 year risk for fatal & non fatal cardio vascular event using WHO / ISH risk predication chart

checkpoint.name: Availability of protocols for screening & treatment for common eye disease of children / adult
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Conjunctivits, night blindness, stye

checkpoint.name: Elementary diagnosis & Referral of Mental disorders as per guidelines
Availablity of Protocol for treatment of Anxiety Neurosis, Mild depression
Epidemiological surveillance of mental disorders as per guideline
Discarded vaccines are kept separately
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for expired, frozen or with VVM beyond the discard point vaccine stored separately

checkpoint.name: AD syringes are available as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for 0.1 ml AD syringe for BCG and 0.5 ml syringe for others are available

checkpoint.name: Staff has knowledge & skills to recognize minor and serious adverse events (AEFI)
Check mother & child protection card is provided to each client
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check MCP card is filled & updated, also check information like record of weight, every child development sign etc are filled correctly

checkpoint.name: Recommended temperature of diluents is ensured before reconstitution
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check diluents are kept under cold chain at least 24 hours before reconstitution
Diluents are kept in vaccine carrier only at immunization clinic but should not be in direct contact of ice pack
